summary: The Wildfire Risk Evaluation Act mandates a quadrennial review of the wildfire environment in the United States, conducted jointly by the Secretaries of Agriculture, Interior, and Homeland Security. This review will analyze changes in built and natural environments, assess the intersection of wildfire and public health, and forecast wildfire challenges over a 20-year period. The act requires a report to Congress detailing findings, recommendations for legislation and administrative action, progress towards existing wildfire management goals, and future scenarios for program realignment.
